subject: Joshua and Distributed Regression Test Suite Execution / Call for Large Test Suites
msgSnippet: [Joshua Announcement] I am currently working on a research project that focues on the distributed execution of regression test suites.  I am using Jini and
messageBody:
[Joshua Announcement]

I am currently working on a research project that focues on the distributed
execution of regression test suites. I am using Jini and JavaSpaces to
implement a tuplespace-based approach to distributed computing. You can find
out more about the Joshua project at:

http://cs.allegheny.edu/~gkapfham/research/joshua/index.html

Furthermore, I have written a paper that will be presented at the 18th
International Conference and Exposition on Testing Computer Software
(TCS 2001). The paper is entitled "Automatically and Transparently
Distributing the Execution of Regression Test Suites." You can obtain access
to this paper at:

http://cs.allegheny.edu/~gkapfham/research/publish/index.html

An implementation of Joshua that integrates into JUnit 3.6 is currently
being developed. My hope is that I will be able to finish this version in
the next month and then provide it for download at:

http://developer.jini.org/exchange/projects/joshua/

[You will have to register on jini.org to download the source code due to the
current SCSL that governs Jini technology. I am hoping to post the source
code on my own web site as well, pending approval.]

[Calling All Large Test Suites]

I would like to conduct an empirical analysis of Joshua's mechanism for
distributing the execution of regression test suites. As of right now, I can
use Joshua's own regression test suite and the test suites of other Java
programs that I or my students have written. However, these will not
be of the appropriate scale for my empirical analysis. Is anyone involved in
the development of a large, Java-based software system that uses JUnit to
perform their testing? I would especially be interested in using and
analyzing the source code and tests for any Java-based open-source projects.
Can you please point me in the direction of project(s) that would be willing
to contribute their code and JUnit tests?

greg

--
Gregory M. Kapfhammer
Instructor, Computer Science Department
Allegheny College
Office: 814-332-2877
gkapfham@...
http://cs.allegheny.edu/~gkapfham/
